label: Description
value:
Recto: Vertical view of an army wagon drawn by mule and driven by a teamster. 
Verso: Various sketches of an officer on horseback, mules drawing a wagon, and a Virginia cabin.

value: Graphite, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value:
Recto: Horizontal view of a beach, wih breakers; in center, men in oilskins beaching a dory; to the left, group of men running towards men at center.

Verso: Figure suggestive of left hand figure in "Eight Bells."

value: Charles Savage Homer, Jr.; 1912: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Description
value: Thick charcoal line divides sheet horizontally into two sections. Upper section contains three groups of figures: large, indistinct one at right; woman with two children, center, moving left; and the third group is in chaotic motion, at left; verso: at bottom right are ornamental motifs; at center is a blotter of two very rough sketches of people running, beside a vertical line.

label: Physical description
value: Charcoal, red chalk, pen and black ink on off-white wove paper

value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of four coastguardsmen pulling, and one pushing a lifeboat along wet sand. Lifeboat resting on carriage wheels; star painted on visible end of boat. Turbulent waves indicated at right edge.

value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

value:
Horizontal view showing a group of figures; at center is a man with his right arm upraised; at left are two figures; and to the right is a faintly indicated rough sea and 
a man launching a lifeboat.
